oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: A Look to the Future
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Printed copy of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.'s speech at 25th anniversary of Highlander. King discusses Black history and the new phase that began after the Supreme Court's decision in Brown v. Board of Education. He mentions White Citizen's Councils and the Ku Klux Klan and their threats of violence on Black Americans. King views the next phase in the fight for equality as Black union membership and the fight for economic equality.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: King, Martin Luther, Jr., 1929-1968
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Highlander Folk School (Monteagle, Tenn.); Horton, Myles, 1905-1990); King, M. Luther (Martin Luther), 1899-1965; United States--Race relations--History; White Citizens councils; White supremacy movements--United States; Civil rights--United States--Cases; White Citizens councils
